title: Understanding France's long political obsession with excessive regulations
summary: Although the government claims to want to combat the administrative complexity that farmers are denouncing with widespread protests, promises of simplification have been a constant feature of French administrations for almost 50 years.

title: Protesting farmers block major roads into Paris
summary: Demonstrating agriculture workers say they are angry about incomes, red tape and environmental policies they say undermine their ability to compete with other countries.

title: The secret adventures of Viktor Orban's son in Africa
summary: Previously a low-profile army officer, Gaspar Orban is now at the heart of Hungary's diplomatic and military offensive in the Sahel region of West Africa.

title: AFCON: Late penalty takes Cape Verde into Cup of Nations quarter-finals
summary: The Blue Sharks advance to a quarter-final on Saturday in Yamoussoukro, against either Morocco or South Africa.

title: 'What has happened is genocide': Massacres in the Sudanese city of El Geneina
summary: According to a UN report, between 10,000 and 15,000 people – mainly from the Masalit community – were killed by General Hemedti's paramilitaries in the West Darfur city.

title: Paris's Centre Pompidou: Employees' three-month strike ends
summary: Two labor unions signed an agreement on Monday to end the dispute at the modern art museum, which is set to close for renovation between 2025 and 2030.

title: Gaza: UN agency for Palestinian refugees plunged into unprecedented turmoil
summary: Israel said that a dozen UNRWA employees were involved in Hamas's October 7 attacks on Israel. The US and several Western countries suspended their funding for the agency.

title: Recolonizing Gaza, the messianic vision of part of Israel's government
summary: Eleven ministers from Benjamin Netanyahu's government took part in a rally gathering several thousand people on Sunday, in which they advocated for the 'transfer' of Palestinians out of the Gaza Strip.

title: Biden vows US 'shall respond' after Iran-backed drone strike kills 3 US troops in Jordan
summary: The strike marks the first time US troops have been killed by enemy fire in the Middle East since the beginning of the war against Hamas.

title: French farmers' protests: Faced with a 'week of danger,' PM Attal promises new measures
summary: On Sunday, Prime Minister Gabriel Attal pledged to 'move forward' on certain demands made by farmers, two days after presenting a first set of announcements in an attempt to quell the mobilization.

title: Tennis: Paris Masters to relocate from Bercy to La Defénse Arena in 2025
summary: The French tennis federation said the move was taking place to comply with ATP requirements. The new venue can seat up to 23,000 spectators.

title: China's real estate giant Evergrande ordered into liquidation by Hong Kong court
summary: The developer had accumulated debts to the order of $328 billion. It is not immediately clear how a legal decision taken in Hong Kong will play out in mainland China, where the group is based.

title: Yair Golan, the October 7 hero defying Benjamin Netanyahu
summary: Long branded a traitor by the Israeli right for criticizing government policies, the former number two of the Israeli army is now being celebrated across the country for his bravery during the Hamas attack. With the launch of the Hitorerut movement, this left-wing Zionist intends to turn his new-found popularity into voting intentions.

title: Could cat-man be the new masculine ideal?
summary: On social media, men pose with their felines to prove that they are not predators. Some see it as the emergence of a masculine identity built around caring and attention.

title: Greater Manchester Police under fire after blatant negligence towards victims of pedophile ring
summary: According to a report published on January 15, police and local authorities in the English city of Rochdale have for years ignored reports and testimonies from vulnerable minors who were victims of rape and sexual exploitation.

title: UK reveals plan to ban disposable e-cigarettes
summary: Health experts welcomed Rishi Sunak's proposal, saying the legislation would have 'a major public health impact across many future generations.'

title: 'Aftershocks' of Evergrande crisis will 'continue to be felt'
summary: Le Monde economic columnist Philippe Escande asks whether the decision to liquidate the heavily indebted property firm will stop the downward spiral of one of China's leading economic sectors.

title: Faced with the housing crisis, Canada restricts access to new immigrants
summary: This year, the number of foreign students receiving study permits will be 35% lower than in 2023.

title: In Russia, feminizing nouns considered a first step towards 'LGBT extremism'
summary: The Russian Supreme Court attributes certain 'customs and traditions' and 'specific language,' such as 'the use of feminized nouns,' to a hypothetical 'international LGBT movement.'

title: In Paris, a wave of Asian coffee shops
summary: Thanks in part to the K-pop, manga and Asian cuisine craze, Vietnamese, Filipino, Taiwanese and Japanese coffee shops are carving a niche for themselves amid Paris bistros.

title: My mother never says my boyfriend's name, it's always 'that guy' or 'that dude'
summary: 'First Times': Tales of pivotal moments around the passage to adulthood. This week, Marie (first name changed), 27, talks about the taboo in her family concerning her romantic relationship.

title: American Christian Zionists crusade against Palestinian 'evil'
summary: The evangelical right is giving its unwavering support for the destruction of Gaza in the name of the fight against what it calls the forces of 'evil' in the Palestinian enclave.

title: AFCON 2024: Hosts Côte d'Ivoire achieve shock victory over Senegal to join Cape Verde in quarter-finals
summary: After scraping into the round of 16, the Elephants managed the impossible when they knocked out the current title holders in a dramatic penalty shoot out.

title: Bolsonaro's son investigated by Brazilian police over alleged spying
summary: Police searched properties belonging to Carlos Bolsonaro as part of an investigation into allegations that his father's political enemies were spied on illegally by the Brazilian intelligence service during his time in office.

title: Hong Kong unveils its own national security law, including five new offenses
summary: This will be in addition to the existing legislation imposed by Beijing in 2020 in response to the huge pro-democracy protests that shook the financial center.
